creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
text: Members of the nobility wore insignia surcoats over dragon robes during formal court ceremonies. These surcoats were dark, full-length gowns decorated with dragon roundels in accordance with the rank of the owner. Because all four of the upper roundels in this robe have front facing, five-claw dragons with shou roundels above their heads, the coat undoubtedly belonged to an emperor.
title: Manchu Nobleman's Semiformal Insignia Surcoat (Gunfu)
